text: The early bird might get the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
A book is like a garden carried in the pocket.
The words of the tongue should have three gatekeepers: Is it true? Is it kind? Is it necessary?
If you chase two rabbits, you will catch neither.

source: Ancient Greek saying (Panta rhei, ouden menei)

text: When spider webs unite, they can tie up a lion.
The nail that sticks out gets hammered down.
Fear not the person who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but fear the person who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.
